properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 2 at 2:26PM MST until February 3 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A winter storm system will bring snow to northeast Wyoming and
the Black Hills region tonight through Monday. Snow amounts of
greater than 6 inches are expected across portions of the northeast
Wyoming plains, the Bear Lodge Mountains, and the northern to
central Black Hills. Forecast amounts taper off fairly quickly
from the foothills of the Black Hills to the adjacent plains of
southwest South Dakota. Snow will begin this evening and continue
through Monday morning. Snow will gradually decrease Monday
afternoon, but could linger across portions of the northeast
Wyoming plains and far southwest South Dakota into Monday evening.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches,
with locally higher amounts possible across the higher foothills.

* WHERE...The Sturgis/Piedmont Foot Hills and the Northern Foot
Hills.

* WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 6 PM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MST MONDAY
